cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 167 (Thursday, October 12, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 5946.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 18 of section 8 of article I of the ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:This bill would prohibit the Department of Defense (DOD)and the District of Columbia National Guard (DCNG) fromtransferring personnel and equipment of the DCNG to DOD orthe National Guard of a state or territory.[Page H5008]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E960)

bill.title: To prohibit the diminution of the District of Columbia National Guard.

item.title: To prohibit the diminution of the District of Columbia National Guard.
To prohibit the diminution of the District of Columbia National Guard.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
